title: Pixel 5 Randomly Disconnects Data and Says "No Sim Card"
content:
I've had my Pixel 5 on T-Mobile for about 7 months and about a week ago it started randomly disconnecting from data and saying "SIM Card Not Detected" where my Data icon usually is. 
 
I've tried:
- Restarting my phone
- Removing and re-inserting the SIM card
- Shutting down the phone for a few hours and turning it back on
- Resetting "Wi-Fi, Mobile & Bluetooth Settings."

^^^ Resetting is the only thing that has worked. It will reconnect me to Data on T-Mobile, but it eventually disconnects again. It will stay connected for anywhere between 2-12 hours. It is annoying to reconnect to my work and home Wi-Fi several times a day as well as my Bluetooth devices.

Has anyone found a long term solution to this. Would a new SIM card do the trick?

Thank you!
